meanings.definition: The edge, rim, or margin of something.
meanings.sent1: She stood on the verge of the cliff, looking down at the ocean below.
meanings.sent2: The flowers grew along the verge of the garden path.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel teetered on the verge of the fence, unsure whether to jump or not.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were on the verge of overflowing, like a dam about to burst.
meanings.sent5: The old house sat on the verge of the forest, its windows peering into the darkness.

meanings.definition: An extreme limit or point beyond which something happens or changes.
meanings.sent1: The company was on the verge of bankruptcy before the new CEO took over.
meanings.sent2: The storm clouds on the horizon signaled the verge of a heavy downpour.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes pushed the verge of good taste, making the audience gasp.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was on the verge of snapping after waiting for hours.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was on the verge of breaking the world record, his determination unwavering.

meanings.definition: To be on the brink or edge of something.
meanings.sent1: She felt like she would verge on tears if she heard one more criticism.
meanings.sent2: The car seemed to verge on breaking down after the long journey.
meanings.sent3: His excitement began to verge on hysteria as he waited for the results.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room seemed to verge on explosion, with everyone on edge.
meanings.sent5: Their friendship would always verge on something more, a line they never crossed.
